radiographic_examinations.findings: The lung bases are clear. Multiple hypodensities scattered throughout the liver likely represent hepatic cysts. The gallbladder shows no stones or wall edema. The spleen is normal. The kidneys demonstrate multiple hypodensities likely representing several cysts. Bilateral parapelvic cysts are also seen. No evidence of obstruction in the intestines. No lymphadenopathy. The appendix measures 10 mm in caliber with a hyperemic-appearing wall and surrounding fat stranding. A single locule of gas is trapped within the fluid-filled appendix. Sigmoid colon demonstrates diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.
